results.title: Catapult
results.creator_credit: Andrew Vial and Andric Film Productions
results.brief_description: Catapult is a poetic film on the sport of pole vaulting and features dual Olympian Ray Boyd and Australian ex-champion Eddy Johnson. Both vaulters are seen in top form as they outdo each other in their attempts to set a new Australian pole vault record. Photographed and edited by Tony Paterson.

results.title: Catamarans
results.creator_credit: Ian Curtis, BBC-TV and West Region Film Unit
results.brief_description: Catamarans, those sailing craft originating from the Pacific with two slender hulls spread apart to give high sail-carrying and stability, have become very popular in England. David Lutyens commentates the film which shows various types of this boat, from the simplest model to the sixty-three foot long passenger craft, and ends with shots of a Catamaran Regatta.

results.title: Catalysis
results.brief_description: A study of catalysis as fourth factor in the velocity of chemical reactions. Explains how catalyst function by absorbing molecules, activating molecules forming an intermediate compound, or starting a chain reaction. Illustrates application of negative catalysts in the manufacture of rubber and anti-knock gasoline.

results.title: Catalysis
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description: Role of catalysis in lowering activation energy explained. Use on platinum gauze in production of nitric acid described, also role of Ti CL3 in polymerization of propene. Model of lysozyme with active site shown. Catalase activity in blood demonstrated. Animation by Stewart Hardy Films.

results.title: Cat journey
results.creator_credit: Lisbeth Gabrielsson, Educational Media International and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: Katie meets a friendly cat which takes her for a rather adventurous ride on its back. Their journey is full of many strange and sometimes scary encounters, but the cat is always there to save Katie. Adapted from the picture book by Ivar Arosenius. Suitable for children 4-7 years.

results.title: Casuarina Equisetifolia
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which look at various species of native trees growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. This film is about a species of pine tree called Casuarina Equisetifolia. Groves of these graceful trees grow on the rocky slopes above the ocean where cicadas hum in their branches and the long clusters of Casuarina needles shimmer silver and black in the breeze. The film follows the development of the small cones. The song of the small brown Honey-eater is heard on the sound track mixed in with the sound of a solo flute. Music performed by Nancy Tow.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a-part series. Explains the facilities available for medical examination and, if necessary, treatment of people who think they may have been exposed to sexually transmitted diseases.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series. Provides basic factual information about infectious diseases which are transmitted by sexual contact. Stresses the importance of seeking proper medical examination and, if necessary, treatment.
